name: Puget Sound region, Washington, United States

records.notes: A University District bound King County Metro Route 271 articulated bus was seen at 15th Ave NE & NE Campus Pkwy in University District.
[SPECIAL] A University District bound King County Metro Route 70 articulated bus was seen on the University Bridge. The bus was a King County Metro's RapidRide vehicle.
A Northgate bound King County Metro Route 41 articulated bus was seen on the express lane of I-5 in Eastlake.
An Everett bound Community Transit Swift Blue Line articulated bus and a Downtown Seattle bound King County Metro RapidRide E Line articulated bus were seen at Aurora Village Transit Center.
A Shoreline bound Community Transit Swift Blue Line articulated bus was seen at Hwy 99 & 220th St SW in Edmonds.
A Downtown Seattle bound Sound Transit Route 577 commuter coach was seen at 4th Ave & Pine St in Downtown Seattle. It would return to Federal Way on the same route.
A Downtown Seattle bound King County Metro Route 14 trolleybus was seen at Mount Baker Transit Center.

An out-of-service Community Transit double-decker was seen at Eastlake Ave NE & NE 40th St in University District, heading Downtown Seattle. It would be assigned as a Lake Stevens bound Route 425 later.

[SPECIAL] A Lakewood bound Pierce Transit Route 594 bus was seen at 4th Ave S & S Jackson St. Route 594 is a Sound Transit route operated under contract by Pierce Transit using Sound Transit's fleet, so it is very rare to see a Pierce Transit vehicle assigned to this route.

[SPECIAL] A Magnolia bound King County Metro Route 24 articulated bus was seen at 3rd Ave & Madison St in Downtown Seattle, followed by a Lake City bound King County Metro Route 41 articulated bus, a Northgate bound King County Metro Route 40 articulated bus and a Downtown Seattle bound King County Metro Route 120 articulated bus. Buses were on snow routes and rear tires were chained due to winter storm.
[SPECIAL] A Downtown Seattle bound King County Metro Route 49 articulated bus was seen at Pine St & 4th Ave in Downtown Seattle. Rear tires were chained due to winter storm.
[SPECIAL] A University District bound King County Metro Route 271 bus was seen at 15th Ave NE & NE Campus Pkwy in University District. Rear tires were chained due to winter storm.
[SPECIAL] An out-of-service King County Metro articulated bus was seen at NE 45th St & University Way NE in University District. This bus finished a Route 48 journey via snow route hours ago.
Interior of an Edmonds bound Community Transit Route 130 articulated bus.

An out-of-service Community Transit double-decker was seen at Roosevelt Way NE & NE 42nd St in University District, heading Downtown Seattle. It would be assigned as a Swamp Creek bound Route 413 later.

A University District bound King County Metro Route 49 articulated bus was seen at 15th Ave NE & NE Campus Pkwy in University District.
A University District bound King County Metro Route 48 articulated bus was seen at 15th Ave NE & NE Campus Pkwy in University District.

An out-of-service King County Metro articulated bus was seen laying over at NE 41st St & University Way NE in University District. The engine was turned off. It would be assigned as a Kirkland bound Route 255 later.

[SPECIAL] Three Everett bound Sound Transit Route 512 double-deckers were seen laying over at 3rd Ave & Madison St in Downtown Seattle. There were police activities, so Route 512 double-deckers were re-routed from 4th Ave to 3rd Ave and was then blocked.

[SPECIAL] A Downtown Seattle bound Sound Transit Route 508 articulated bus was seen on the I-5 in Shoreline. During July and November 2020, Mountlake Terrace Freeway Station was closed due to the construction of Link light rail Lynnwood extension. Therefore, Sound Transit provided this free shuttle service between Mountlake Terrace and Downtown Seattle.

Interior of a Mount Baker bound King County Metro Route 14 bus. Due to COVID-19, front area of the bus was blocked by a safety strap and normal passages were only allowed to use the rear doors to board the bus. Fare collection was suspended from March 21 to September 31, 2020.

[SPECIAL] A University District bound King County Metro Route 70 trolleybus was seen at Fairview Ave N & Valley St. It was not usual to assign a single-section trolleybus to Route 70. Before the closure of Fairview Ave N wooden bridge, northbound trolleybuses used battery to run along Fairview Ave N between Aloha St and E Garfield St, as trolley poles needed to be lowered.
